public Table(int id,
                  java.lang.String name,

           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        name - The name this table will have.
        id - The id of the table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ("Table name must not be empty.") if the given name is invalid. | !isValidName(name)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ("The table id should be strictly positive.") if the given name is invalid. | id <= 0

      • getNbRows

        public int getNbRows()
        Returns the number of rows.
        Returns:
        0 if there are no columns in this table. | if (getNbColumns() == 0) | result == 0 Otherwise, the number of values (rows) of the first column of this table. | else | result == getColumnAt(1).getNbValues()

      • getCellValue

        public java.lang.String getCellValue(int id,
                                     int row)
                              throws IllegalColumnException,
                                     IllegalRowException
        Return the cell at the given row of the column with the given column id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the column of which the cell must be returned.
        row - The row number of the row of the cell that must be returned.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There isn't a column with the given id in this table. | !hasAsColumn(id)
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getNbRows() || row < 1

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the column.
        row - The row number of the row.
        value - The value to be checked.
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There isn't a column with the given id in this table. | !hasAsColumn(id)
        IllegalRowException - The row doesn't exists. | row > getNbRows() || row < 1
